flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education. Topic: Secure logging practices without sensitive data exposure (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > 008_Application Security > Secure Software Development Lifecycle > 006_Secure Implementation and Coding > Secure Coding Practices > Secure logging practices without sensitive data exposure). Incorporate these exactly: - Learning Objectives: [paste the learning_objectives array here] - Active Learning: Use elements in scenario-based cards (e.g., 'Debate-style Q: Argue against...'). - Scaffolding Layers: Distribute cards: 15 Layer1, 15 Layer2, 10 Layer3, 10 Layer4. - Research: Core concepts (log data/management, sensitive data); OWASP: Avoid PII/creds/tokens, structured JSON, mask/anonymize, no log injection; NIST SP 800-92: Lifecycle for incidents/compliance. Examples: Insecure code logs passwords; Secure: userId + timestamp. Follow Flashcard Schema: - Output JSON array of 50 flashcards. - Each: {'front': str, 'back': {'answer': str, 'explanation': str, 'references': [str]}, 'bloom_level': str, 'layer': int} - Distractors: MCQs only, per protocol (misconceptions like 'logs internal only'). - Varied types: MCQ, short answer, code completion. - Ensure pedagogical depth: Tie to Bloom's, active recall, no sensitive data in examples. Sources: OWASP Logging Cheat Sheet (https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/Logging_Cheat_Sheet.html), NIST SP 800-92 Rev. 1 (https://csrc.nist.gov/pubs/sp/800/92/r1/draft). Generate now.
